newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest hogs seen $0.50-$1.00 lower - dealers.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest hogs seen $0.50-$1.00 lower - dealers.

text.p: Midwest cash hog prices Thursday were expected to continue the lower trend started last week amid a seasonal increase in hog numbers and subsequent pressure on hog and pork prices, livestock dealers said.
Hog prices were seen down $0.50 to $1.00 per cwt, with top prices in Iowa and southern Minnesota expected to range from $52.00 to $52.50 for hogs delivered to plants.
Illinois top prices also were seen ranging from $52.00 to $52.50 at plants.
Indiana and Ohio sources expect top plant prices to range from $52.00 to $53.00.

Hog marketings were starting to slow in some areas following larger-than-expected interior movement Tuesday. Some of the hogs were animals not sold Monday because of the Labor Day holiday, sources said.
USDA reported interior Iowa/southern Minnesota movement Tuesday at 109,000 head which exceeded its estimate of 105,000. USDA estimated Wednesday's run at 105,000 head.

Hog price losses Thursday could be curbed if operating margins turn profitable for packers and plans for a large Saturday slaughter gather momentum. Margins were mixed Wednesday, depending on plant efficiency, a packer buyer said.
